items.title: Slot, Salah 'talking' about Liverpool return date
items.summary: Arne Slot has said he is happy to have Mohamed Salah returning from the Africa Cup of Nations, insisting he continues to be "so important" for Liverpool.

items.title: FC Eindhoven houdt toptalent uit handen van de Eredivisie
items.summary: Thijs Muller (18) tekent na negen wedstrijden in de Keuken Kampioen Divisie zijn eerste profcontract. De aanvallende middenvelder genoot concrete interesse uit de Eredivisie, maar kiest voor een langer verblijf bij FC Eindhoven. Dat bevestigen ingewijden.

items.title: 'If I had 15 attackers I'd be happy to have Salah back'
items.summary: Mohamed Salah returns to Liverpool next week with boss Arne Slot saying he would be pleased to have the forward back even if he had "15 attackers".

items.title: 'Manchester City wil doorpakken met Guehi, Villa schakelt door'
items.summary: De tijd van winterse versterkingen is aangebroken, in dit blog volgen we alle transferactiviteit in het buitenland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in Nederland.

items.title: Opsteker voor Bayern en Duitsland: Musiala keert terug van zware blessure
items.summary: Bayern M√ºnchen kan zaterdag weer een beroep doen op Jamal Musiala. De 22-jarige Duitser lag een halfjaar uit de roulatie, maar is hersteld van een beenbreuk, zo maakte trainer Vincent Kompany bekend. De aanstaande rentree van Musiala is eveneens goed nieuws voor Duitsland in aanloop naar het WK.

items.title: De Graafschap met piepjong elftal op koers voor play-offs
items.summary: In de Keuken Kampioen Divisie staan dit weekend een paar topduels op het programma. ADO Den Haag en SC Cambuur, de twee titelfavorieten, treffen elkaar vrijdag in Den Haag. Zondag gaat nummer drie De Graafschap op bezoek bij Almere City, in een belangrijk duel om de play-offs. De Graafschap staat er goed voor, maar kent wel een merkwaardig seizoen. Dit zijn de meest opvallende zaken over de piepjonge ploeg van trainer Marinus Dijkhuizen.

items.title: Kraker in de KKD: zo staan ADO en Cambuur ervoor richting hun ontmoeting
items.summary: Vrijdagavond hervatten ADO Den Haag en SC Cambuur hun Keuken Kampioen Divisie-seizoen. Dat doen zij direct met een kraker. De nummers √©√©n en twee staan immers tegenover elkaar. Zo staan zij ervoor.

Ed Aarons and Romain Molina report: Several presidents of African football federations have told the Guardian they were not informed of the decision until it was surprisingly announced by the Caf president, Patrice Motsepe, on 20 December, prompting claims that the confederation breached its statutes by failing to seek approval at a general assembly. items.title: Man Utd's Mart√≠nez: Wanted to quit after ACL tear
items.summary: Manchester United defender Lisandro Mart√≠nez has revealed that during the darkest moments of his recovery from a torn ACL, he seriously considered walking away from football.

items.title: Pulisic stays on bench as Rabiot inspires Milan win
items.summary: AC Milan won 3-1 at in-form Como on Thursday, with Adrien Rabiot winning a penalty and then scoring two goals.

items.title: Mexico calls up dual-nationals Ledezma, Guti√©rrez
items.summary: United States-Mexico dual-nationals Richard Ledezma and Brian Guti√©rrez earned their first call-ups for Mexico's senior national team on Thursday ahead of non-FIFA date friendlies against Panama on Jan. 22 and Bolivia on Jan 25.

items.title: Laurens' weekend preview: Madrid's redemption?; Carrick's Man United debut; AFCON final
items.summary: It's Friday and another full weekend of action awaits across the soccer calendar as Julien Laurens picks out the best games to watch in Europe.

items.title: Carrick is 'the correct appointment at the right time' for Man Utd
items.summary: After Michael Carrick's appointment as Manchester United head coach until the end of the season, Sky Sports News reporter Dan Khan examines why he is the correct choice for the club...

items.title: Roma sign forward Malen from Aston Villa
items.summary: Netherlands forward Donyell Malen joins Roma from Aston Villa after just one year with the Premier League side.

items.title: Football transfer rumours: Murillo to replace Maguire at Manchester United?
items.summary: Today‚Äôs rumours might even get home one day This year, as with last year, Aston Villa are eyeing the January market to bolster their forward line. For Marcus Rashford in 2025, read Tammy Abraham in 2026. Roma own his registration, though he is now on loan at Besiktas. He was a fan favourite when on loan from Chelsea in Villa‚Äôs Championship days, so such a move would be something of a homecoming. Another Villa target is Dani Ceballos, the midfielder once of Arsenal, and a useful Real Madrid squad player for years now. To compound Crystal Palace‚Äôs FA Cup misery, and the unsettling tidings on Oliver Glasner‚Äôs future, there‚Äôs the rumour that Jean-Philippe Mateta is a target for Juventus. Continue reading...

items.title: African football chiefs accused of not consulting fully over controversial Afcon change
items.summary: Tournament to be played every four years from 2028 Federation denies statutes breached in making decision The Confederation of African Football (Caf) has been accused of pushing through its controversial decision to stage the Africa Cup of Nations (Afcon) every four years without properly consulting member federations. Several presidents of African football federations have told the Guardian they were not informed of the decision until it was surprisingly announced by the Caf president, Patrice Motsepe, on 20 December, prompting claims that the confederation breached its statutes by failing to seek approval at a general assembly. Continue reading...

items.title: Cardiff boss Barry-Murphy: Hopefully I can deliver for Vincent Tan, or else...
items.summary: The January transfer window is open and clubs up and down the land are looking for new players. But it's all quiet at Cardiff.

items.title: Gauff: Grand Slam prize money 'not where we would like it'
items.summary: Coco Gauff has led calls for the four Grand Slams to increase the prize money on offer further amid an ongoing dispute between tennis' leading players and the major tournaments.

items.title: Danish star Rune: Tennis has become unnecessarily demanding
items.summary: Holger Rune has hit out at tennis' money-makers, calling for "adjustments in the scheduling" and labelled the expanded Masters 1000 events as unnecessarily demanding..

items.title: Red Bull expect 'to be trailing' rivals at start of 2026 F1 season
items.summary: Red Bull chief Laurent Mekies has admitted he expects the team "to be trailing" their front-running rivals at the start of the 2026 Formula 1 season.
